metadata.title: CVE-2019-11358 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description: jQuery before 3.4.0, as used in Drupal, Backdrop CMS, and other products,mishandles jQuery.extend(true, {}, ...) because of Object.prototypepollution. If an unsanitized source object contained an enumerable__proto__ property, it could extend the native Object.prototype.

criterions.comment: jquery: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
node-jquery: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
drupal7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
otrs2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
